item.description:
Come and join us for a fun night out at Medieval Manor!

You will enjoy a 6- course FEAST with a musical and adult comedy show in a Medieval setting, presided by a King and a Queen, and served and sung by bawdy wenches & court boys!

Dinner includes: Bread and cheese trenchers, mussels, soup, beef ribs, salad, herbed chicken, and steamed vegetables. Included in the dinner is pitchers of beer, wine, mead or root beer, and a CASH bar also has a larger variety of beer, wine, soda and mixed drinks available.

The show begins at 8:30 sharp (do NOT be late as you will be made an exapmple of by the King!) and the doors open at 8:00 which is when we will be gathering.

The cost is $50.00 per person, and MUST be paid within 10 days of making the reservation.

I will be collecting money from NOW until our Samhain Celebration on Sat. Oct 22nd-

If I do not have the money by that date, you will NOT be able to go- no exceptions!!!

 

I would PREFER to be given a check or cash, but if you are unable to do this, and need to use paypal, email me at talawolf7@webtv.net and I will send you a paypal link that can be paid with a credit card. You can mail checks to me, stating on the check that it is for Medieval Manor at: Robin Paladino, 84 Old Boston Turnpike Rd. Hubbardston, Mass 01452-

or you can give me the money in person at classes or at the Samhain celebration.

Please bring some extra CASH for the bar and to leave a TIP at the end of the show....

 

For more information

check out their website at:

http://medievalmanor.com/main.html
item.how_to_find_us: In 1982, after 10 years in the basement of the Eliot Hotel, we relocated to 246 East Berkeley Street, between Albany and Harrison, in Boston's South End. We are in the first brick building on the right, diagonally across from the Mobil station.
item.name: Medieval Manor Dinner & Show
